column3: qŭóniam suscepìsti me~; nec delectavìsti inimícos meos super me. ^ I will extol thee
column6: and hast not made my enemies to rejoice over me.

column3: et sanavìsti me. ^ O Lord my God

column1: 4 ^ Dòmine eduxìsti ab infèrno ánimam meam~; salvavìsti me a descendèntibus in lacum. ^ Thou hast brought forth
column3: my soul from hell~; thou hast saved me from them that go down into the pit.
et confitémini memóriaĕ sanctitátis ejus. ^ Sing to the Lord
column5: and give praise to the memory of his holiness.

column2: et vita in voluntáte ejus. Ad vèsperum demorábitur fletus
column3: et ad matutínum laĕtìția. ^ For wrath is in his indignation
column4: and life in his good will. In the evening weeping shall have place

column1: 7 ^ Ego aŭtem dixi in abundánția mea
column2: «~Non movébor in aĕtèrnum.~»^ And in my abundance I said

column3: praĕstitìsti decóri meo virtútem. Avertìsti fáčiem tuam a me
column4: et factus sum conturbátus. ^ O Lord
column6: thou gavest strength to my beauty. Thou turnedst away thy face from me

column4: et ad Deum meum deprecábor. ^ To thee
column7: and I will make supplication to my God.

column2: dum descèndo in corrupțiónem~? ¿~Numqŭid confitébitur tìbi pùlvis
column3: aŭt adnunțiábit veritátem tuam~? ^ What profit is there in my blood
column4: whilst I go down to corruption~? Shall dust confess to thee

column2: et misèrtus est mei~; Dòminus factus est adjútor meus. ^ The Lord hath heard
column3: and hath had mercy on me~; the Lord became my helper.

column1: 12 ^ Convertuìsti planctum meum in gáŭdium mìchi~; conscidìsti saccum meum
column3: ^ Thou hast turned for me my mourning into joy~; thou hast cut my sackcloth
column4: and hast compassed me with gladness

column2: et non compunǧar~; Dòmine Deus meus
column3: in aĕtèrnum confitébor tìbi. ^ that my glory may sing to thee
column4: and I may not regret~; O Lord my God
column5: I will give praise to thee for ever.
